alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 24 at 2:30AM MDT until March 25 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR MUCH OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Stronger winds and a much drier airmass will move in from the west early Saturday, bringing several hours of critical fire weather conditions to the eastern plains and highlands. The strongest winds will occur around mid day, but critical fire weather conditions will likely continue into the early evening hours. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Saturday morning through Saturday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (Zone 104), East Central Plains (Zone 126), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) and the Central Highlands (Zone 125) Saturday morning through Saturday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 25 to 35 mph with occasional gusts to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...9 to 14 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains
